Description: Insert uvcvideo module
StepDescription: Plug realsense camera (R200) to the usb3.0 port of platform

ExpectedResult: There is no error about R200 init failure

Description: Launch example cpp-capture to enable 4 camera preview streaming
StepDescription: Plug realsense camera (R200) to the usb3.0 port of platform
Download librealsense code if cpp-capture example is not built in image. From github https://github.com/IntelRealSense/librealsense.
Build the code by 'make BACKEND=LIBUVC' and 'make install'
Run ./bin/cpp-capture . Click mouse to make it launch on the desptop.
ExpectedResult: There are 4 camera shown in the windows with smooth video streaming.

Description: Launch cpp-config-ui app, and adjust COLOR_BRIGHTNESS

ExpectedResult: Color camera takes effect

Description: Launch cpp-config-ui app, and adjust COLOR_CONTRAST

ExpectedResult: Color camera takes effect

Description: Launch cpp-config-ui app, and adjust R200_LR_GAIN

ExpectedResult: All cameras take effect

Description: Launch cpp-config-ui app, and adjust R200_DEPTH_CONTROL_MEDIAN_THRESHOLD

ExpectedResult: Color camera takes effect

Description: Launch cpp-enumerate-devices
ExpectedResult: All the camera supporting options are listed

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: The log output smoothly, showing 'tinymembench v0.4.9 (simple benchmark for memory throughput and latency)' and followed by detail log,  no error, break and crash message.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: The log shows '`stress' imposes certain types of compute stress on your system' and followed by its usage

The log outputs smoothly and ends after about 10s, and no error message. For exmaple, 'stress: info: [19459] dispatching hogs: 4 cpu, 4 io, 2 vm, 0 hdd
stress: info: [19459] successful run completed in 10s'.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: Version information and usage of memtester output and no any error, break and crash message included.
The log outputs smoothly,  no error, break and crash message included.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: Usage of lmbench included, no error, break and crash message
Log outputs smoothly, started with lmbench configuration seesion.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: Log shows the usage of iozone, no erroe, break and crash message.
The detail test result of iozone shows in log and no error, break and crash message.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: The log outputs smoothly, started with penGL information, no error, break and crash message.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: Log outputs smoothly, including detail test result(passed, failed and skipped). No error, break and crash message.

Description: Check the menchmark integartion and work well or not

ExpectedResult: Usage of lmbench output in log, no error, break and crash message.
Logs output smoothly, including detail test result. No error, break and crash message.

Description: Verify core functions of opencv work as expected by leveraging ~185 upstream TCs
StepDescription: Get the required test data from OpenCV extra repository: git clone https://github.com/Itseez/opencv_extra.git
ExpectedResult: No error happens

StepDescription: set OPENCV_TEST_DATA_PATH environment variable to <path to opencv_extra/testdata>.
ExpectedResult: Verify this variable is set by echo command

StepDescription: execute tests from build directory. run /usr/bin/opencv_test_core
ExpectedResult: No error should happen idealy.

Description: Verify opencv can be successfully initialized
ExpectedResult: OpenCV version should return

Description: Verify image can be opend by opencv
ExpectedResult: No error happens
DUT should show up GUI interface.
The image showed out correctly.

Description: Verify video can be displayed by opencv
ExpectedResult: No error happens
DUT should show up GUI interface.
The video should be displayed properly

Description: Verify UPM libraries are installed in image
StepDescription: login DUT and go to root directory by cd / and find ./ -name *upm*.
ExpectedResult: Check corresponding UPM libraries exist, like /usr/include/upm, /usr/lib/libupm-*.so, /usr/lib/pkgconfig/upm-*.pc,

Description: Verify MRAA libraries are installed in image
StepDescription: login DUT and go to root directory by cd / and find ./ -name *mraa*.
ExpectedResult: Check corresponding MRAA libraries exist, like /usr/include/mraa*, /usr/lib/libmraa-*.so, /usr/lib/pkgconfig/mraa.pc,

StepDescription: cp hello-mraa from testsuite /deploy/target to DUT and run ./hello_mraa
ExpectedResult: mraa version is in output and the platform name saying unsupported.

Description: Check if TPM is enabled in kernel

ExpectedResult: No error happens

StepDescription: Check in the .config file for CONFIG_TCG_TPM
ExpectedResult: configure is set to yes (y)

StepDescription: Check in the .config file for CONFIG_TCG_TIS
ExpectedResult: configure is set to yes (y)

there is xdk-daemon process listed
xdk-daemon service restarted

Description: check if the indigo files installed
ExpectedResult: /opt/ros/indigo exists
There is bin folder under /opt/ros/indigo
All the three tools exist

Description: check if the catkin_make related files installed
ExpectedResult: The catkin_make tool exists

Description: check if the python library files installed
ExpectedResult: The python library files are in ./lib/python2.7 folder

Description: run roscore command
StepDescription:
Setup environment:
export ROS_ROOT=/opt/ros/indigo
export PATH=$PATH:/opt/ros/indigo/bin
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/ros/indigo/lib
export PYTHONPATH=/opt/ros/indigo/lib/python2.7/site-packages
export ROS_MASTER_URI=http://localhost:11311
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/opt/ros/indigo
touch /opt/ros/indigo/.catkin

ExpectedResult: The terminal will output /rosversion and 'started core service'

Description: Check opencl app build in dev image

StepDescription: unzip the zip package and build the app "SimpleOptimizations" by make
ExpectedResult: the app can be built successfully
the app can be execution successfully
